## APN: Chemical and Biological Laboratories CFB Suffield, Alberta, Canada

### Tender Summary

* APN Number: MX-43072118413
* Solicitation Number: 82392
* Closing Date: 2024-05-01T16:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-08-01
* Expected Contract End Date: 2024-08-01

### Project Overview

* The purpose of this Advance Procurement Notice (APN) is to announce the intent to procure a contract for the design and construction of new facilities to house the Chemical and Biological Laboratories (CBL) at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Suffield, Alberta, Canada.
* The project will be delivered using the Modified Design Build delivery method.
* The scope of work includes the design and construction of a consolidated and modernized chemical and biological research facility, consisting of offices, laboratories, storage, administration, and other support areas.
* The new facility is to be designed and built to meet Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) Silver certification standards.

### Security Requirements

* The contractor will be required to hold a valid Facility Security Clearance (FSC) at the level of SECRET, issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).
* Personnel requiring access to classified or protected information must hold a valid personnel security screening at the level of SECRET or REliability Status, granted or approved by the CSP, PWGSC.

### Industrial Security Program (ISP) Sponsorship

* Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is providing sponsors for consultants or contractors to access the security clearance process through the ISP.
* To obtain sponsorship, consultants or contractors must submit a sponsorship request application to DCC, providing the contract number (82392) and the level of security clearance requested.

### Important Dates

* The anticipated solicitation closing date is Summer/Fall 2024, pending contract approval by the Department of National Defence (DND).
* The contractor will be required to have the necessary security clearances in place prior to the closing date.

### Contact Information

* Ryan Pfeifer, Defence Construction Canada, (403) 544-4901, Ryan.Pfeifer@dcc-cdc.gc.ca

### Disclaimer

* DCC does not guarantee that a sponsorship request package or security clearance application will be successful or result in the granting of the requested security clearance.
